page.title: 01A general survey
page.content:
The survey area is generally flat, the highest point being only 43m. above sea level. It is{mainly {agricultural land;}but there are also scattered pockets of woodland.
The area is{thinly populated,}with most people living in the villages of Weeton, Great Plumpton and Little Plumpton. Scattered over the area are eight farms.
Two main{roads,}the M55 motorway and the A583 Preston New Road, and a {railway}link the Fylde coast holiday resorts with the rest of Lancashire.
It is provided with few{amenities} - two churches, a primary school, a village hall and a petrol filling station, but no shops or doctors' surgeries.
